instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hey all - very small corrosion around <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and j5100.

Replaced <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>

i get no green light but <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present @ 3.43v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.24v
ppvrtc 3.34v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0v

and also no <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.24v"
Bad communication between SMC and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

Post voltage and resistance to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Do you get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>?
If not, try to reflow the SMC; better to reball it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I was thinking you will use diode mode (red probe to ground) for resistance test...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Less than 1% difference allowed there.
You have a bad contact on SCL, or something affects SDA line.

The issue can be SMC, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, or battery connector (corrosion).
Remove <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> first and check if readings are similar; let the board to cool down, before measuring.
If still bad, put good flux and reflow SMC.
If no result, try reballing it.
Change it, as last option.

Be aware of battery connector; clean it as best as possible.

changed ISL625 all good now.

i have a question - i notice isl625 9ahrtz and 9hrtz. the orientation is different - but are they interchangeable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I ran board through ultrasonic and put back together only to find out i got 1.1v on ppbus - still got green light when i press power it light flashes off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check resistance to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Next check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Post some voltages for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

Do NOT use UC without real reason!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
res to ground .131v

resistance 17/18 .0001v
resistance 27/28 .706v

i had some alot of flux on there so thats why i use UC. i run at @ 60c for 1-2 minutes each side.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is cycling - light is turning on and off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"resistance 27/28 .706v"
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 open, or bad/corroded trace.

Use ohm mode for low values.
You should get 20 ohms there; aprox 010 in diode mode.

BTW, remove the end "v" from diode mode readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
informaticos.... how did you know? just as you said holes in <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 thank you are genius but how?

[QUOTE]BTW, remove the end "v" from diode mode readings...[/QUOTE] lol thats what my multi says...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: The "V" sign can confuse as, thinking about voltage reading (power applied on board), instead of diode mode (no power on the board)
